Authors:
Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe, Peter E Mortimer, Jian-Chu
Xu
Title:
Insight into the systematics of microfungi colonizing
Dodonaea viscosa in Honghe (China)
Abstract:
Members of Dodonaea are widely distributed in the
subtropical and tropical areas of southwest and southern China. This
host provides multiple substrates which can be richly colonized by
numerous undescribed fungal species. Microfungal studies of Dodonaea in
China are highly lacking and consequently, the diversity, phylogeny and
taxonomy of these microorganisms are largely unknown. This paper
presents two new genera and four new species in three orders of
Dothideomycetes, collected from dead twigs of Dodonaea viscosa in
Honghe, China. All the new collections were made within a selected area
in Honghe from a single Dodonaea sp., indicating a high fungal diversity
in the region from which numerous species remain to be discovered.
Multiple gene sequences (non-translated loci and protein-coding regions)
were analysed using maximum likelihood and Bayesian analyses. In the
phylogenetic analyses based on a combined dataset of Teratosphaeriaceae
provide support for the recognition of Haniomyces dodonaeae gen. et sp.
nov. Analysis of Rhytidhysteron sequences resulted in Rhytidhysteron
hongheense sp. nov. while Lophiostomataceae sequences analysed revealed
Lophiomurispora hongheensis gen. et sp. nov. Finally, phylogeny based on
combined dataset of pyrenochaeta-like sequences demonstrates in strong
statistical support of Quixadomyces hongheensis sp. nov. in
Parapyrenochaetaceae. Morphological and updated phylogenetic
circumscriptions vis-Ã -vis the new discoveries are well discussed
herein.
